name: Create Worksite
brief: Establish farms, mines, quarries, or lumber camps
description: Establish resource extraction operations to harness the natural wealth of your territories

criticalSuccess.description: Immediately gain 1 Resource of the appropriate type, the Worksite is established and produces next turn

success.description: The Worksite is established and produces next turn

special: Choose a controlled hex. Establish a valid Worksite (Farm, Quarry, Mine, or Lumbermill)

name: Collect Stipend
brief: Extract personal income (requires Counting House)
description: Draw personal funds from the kingdom's treasury as compensation for your service

criticalSuccess.description: Gain double the listed amount

failure.description: Gain half the listed amount, and the kingdom gains +1 Unrest

criticalFailure.description: Gain nothing, and the kingdom gains +1d4 Unrest

requirements: Counting House (T2) or higher Taxation structure
special: The PC gains personal Gold based on the settlement's level and the highest active Taxation tier in the kingdom

name: Harvest Resources
brief: Harvest materials from controlled hexes
description: Harvest materials from your territories through direct extraction from the land

criticalSuccess.description: Gain 1 resource from the hex + identify ideal location (+2 untyped bonus to Create Worksite in this hex)

criticalFailure.description: The hex is depleted; it cannot be harvested again next turn

special: May harvest from any controlled hex. Each hex can only be harvested once per turn. Resource type depends on terrain.

name: Purchase Resources
brief: Negotiate exchange rate then buy resources
description: Use the kingdom's treasury to acquire needed materials from trade partners. Roll to determine the exchange rate, then purchase any amount at that rate.

criticalSuccess.description: Establish 1:1 exchange rate (pay 1 gold per resource)

success.description: Establish 2:1 exchange rate (pay 2 gold per resource)

special: Choose a single resource type, then purchase any amount at the determined rate.

name: Sell Surplus
brief: Trade 2 resources for gold
description: Convert excess resources into gold through trade with merchants and neighboring kingdoms

criticalSuccess.description: Trade 2 Resources → 2 Gold

special: Trade a single resource type for gold

name: Build Roads
brief: Connect your territory with infrastructure
description: Construct pathways between settlements to improve trade, travel, and military movement

criticalSuccess.description: Build road segments based on your skill proficiency

name: Claim Hexes
brief: Expand your kingdom's territorial control
description: Expand your kingdom's borders by claiming adjacent wilderness hexes through surveying, settlement, and administrative control

criticalSuccess.description: Claim hexes based on your skill proficiency

special: Can only claim hexes adjacent to existing kingdom territory

name: Fortify Hex
brief: Strengthen defensive positions
description: Construct or upgrade defensive fortifications in claimed territory to improve resistance against invasion

tiers.name: Earthworks
tiers.description: Basic earthen defensive positions with ditches and berms

tiers.name: Stone Tower
tiers.description: Stone tower with reinforced defensive walls

tiers.name: Fortress
tiers.description: Massive fortified keep with multiple defensive layers
tiers.special: Units stationed here require no gold upkeep

criticalSuccess.description: Build/upgrade fortification, reduce Unrest by 1

special: Must be placed in claimed territory. Automatically upgrades existing fortifications by one tier. Unpaid maintenance reduces effectiveness by one tier (minimum Tier 1).

name: Send Scouts
brief: Learn about unexplored hexes
description: Dispatch explorers to gather intelligence about neighboring territories and potential threats

criticalSuccess.description: Learn about 2 hexes. Reveal the chosen hexes on the map.

success.description: Learn about 1 hex. Reveal the chosen hex on the map.

name: Diplomatic Mission
brief: Improve relations with a faction
description: Send envoys to improve your kingdom's standing with neighboring powers and influential organizations

criticalSuccess.description: Your diplomats achieved exceptional results! {Faction} improves their attitude toward your kingdom.

success.description: {Faction} improves their attitude toward your kingdom.

failure.description: Your diplomatic mission yielded no results, but relations remain stable.

criticalFailure.description: Your diplomats offended {Faction}! Their attitude worsens.

name: Hire Adventurers
brief: Pay gold to resolve events (2 Gold cost)
description: Contract independent heroes and mercenaries to handle dangerous tasks or resolve kingdom events

criticalSuccess.description: The adventurers resolve one ongoing Event entirely

success.description: Roll to resolve an Event with a +2 circumstance bonus

failure.description: The adventurers cause trouble. Gain +1 Unrest

criticalFailure.description: The adventurers vanish or turn rogue. Gain +2 Unrest

special: Limit: This action may only be attempted once per Kingdom Turn

name: Infiltration
brief: Gather intelligence through espionage
description: Deploy spies and agents to gather intelligence on rival kingdoms or potential threats

criticalSuccess.description: Valuable intel

name: Request Economic Aid
brief: Ask allies for resources or gold
description: Appeal to allied nations for material support in times of need

criticalSuccess.description: Gain 3 Resources of your choice OR 3 Gold

success.description: Gain 2 Resources of your choice OR 2 Gold

name: Request Military Aid
brief: Call for allied troops in battle
description: Call upon allies to provide troops or military support during conflicts

criticalSuccess.description: Gain 2 allied troops or a powerful special detachment for 1 battle

name: Recover Army
brief: Heal and restore damaged units
description: Tend to wounded troops, restore morale, and replenish ranks after battle losses

criticalSuccess.description: Troop recovers completely

name: Deploy Army
brief: Move troops to strategic positions
description: Mobilize and maneuver your military forces across the kingdom's territory using various navigation methods

criticalSuccess.description: Move, claim hex after battle

failure.description: Move but -2 initiative, and troop is fatigued

criticalFailure.description: Your troop is lost they arrive at a Random nearby hex (1d6 for direction, 1-3 for offset); troop has -2 initiative, is fatigued and enfeebled 1; +1 Unrest

name: Disband Army
brief: Decommission troops and return soldiers home
description: Release military units from service, returning soldiers to civilian life

criticalSuccess.description: People welcome them home with honours!, -2 Unrest

name: Outfit Army
brief: Equip troops with armor, weapons, runes, or equipment
description: Equip your troops with superior arms, armor, and supplies to enhance their battlefield effectiveness

criticalSuccess.description: Outfit a troop with two upgrades, or 2 troops with the same upgrade

special: Equipment types: armor (+1 AC), runes (+1 to hit), weapons (+1 damage dice), equipment (+1 saving throws)

name: Recruit Unit
brief: Raise new troops for your armies
description: Rally citizens to arms, drawing from the population to form new military units through inspiration, coercion, or demonstration of prowess

criticalSuccess.description: Recruit a troop equal to the party level and reduce unrest by 1 as patriotism spreads

gameCommands.description: Create new army unit at party level

success.description: Recruit a troop equal to the party level

gameCommands.description: Create new army unit at party level

name: Train Army
brief: Improve unit levels up to party level
description: Drill your troops in tactics and discipline to improve their combat effectiveness through various training methods

criticalSuccess.description: Troop is promoted up to party level

name: Arrest Dissidents
brief: Convert current unrest to imprisoned unrest
description: Round up troublemakers and malcontents, converting unrest into imprisoned unrest that can be dealt with through the justice system

criticalSuccess.description: Convert up to 8 Unrest to imprisoned Unrest

success.description: Convert up to 4 Unrest to imprisoned Unrest

criticalFailure.description: Botched arrests cause riots; gain 1 Unrest

name: Deal with Unrest
brief: Directly reduce unrest by 1-3 based on success
description: Address grievances and calm tensions through various approaches: entertainment, religious ceremonies, shows of force, diplomatic engagement, scholarly discourse, or magical displays

criticalSuccess.description: Widespread Support

name: Execute or Pardon Prisoners
brief: Deal with imprisoned unrest through justice
description: Pass judgment on those who have threatened the kingdom's stability, choosing between mercy and justice

criticalSuccess.description: Remove all imprisoned Unrest in the settlement and reduce Unrest by 1

success.description: Remove 1d4 imprisoned Unrest from the settlement

criticalFailure.description: Remove none; gain 1 current Unrest (riot, scandal, martyrdom)

name: Build Structure
brief: Add markets, temples, barracks, and other structures
description: Construct new buildings and infrastructure within a settlement to enhance its capabilities

criticalSuccess.description: Build a {structure} for half cost

criticalFailure.description: Accidents and disputes plauge the {structure} project.

name: Establish Settlement
brief: Found a new village
description: Found a new community where settlers can establish homes and begin building infrastructure

criticalSuccess.description: Village established and gain 1 free Tier 1 Structure of your choice
manualEffects: Place the new village on the hex map
Choose and add any Tier 1 structure to the new settlement
Place the new village on the hex map

failure.description: Scouts, surveyors, and initial supplies are wasted

criticalFailure.description: Complete disaster - resources wasted, public embarrassment, confidence shaken

special: A new settlement begins as a level 1 Village unless special circumstances apply. Must be founded in a claimed hex with no other settlement within 4 hexes.

name: Repair Structure
brief: Fix damaged buildings to restore functionality
description: Repair damaged structures within a settlement to restore its capabilities. You must select a structure first, then perform the skill check. Only the lowest tier damaged structure per category can be repaired.

criticalSuccess.description: Citizens volunteer their time and materials. The {structure} is repaired for free!

success.description: you repair the {structure}. Choose to pay either tier × d4 gold OR half the original build cost.

failure.description: Despite your efforts, the {structure} remains damaged.

criticalFailure.description: Time and money are wasted. The {structure} remains damaged.

name: Upgrade Settlement
brief: Increase settlement level by 1
description: Invest in infrastructure and development to advance your settlement's capabilities and unlock access to more advanced structures

criticalSuccess.description: {Settlement} level increases by 1 at half the cost (rounded up)

failure.description: Construction setbacks and delays waste resources and achieve nothing in {Settlement}.

criticalFailure.description: Accidents and incompetance waste the full investment in {Settlement} achieving nothing.

requirements: Settlement meets structure requirements for next tier
special: Cost equals the settlement's NEW level in gold.
